fighter.name: Second Wind
fighter.shortDescription: Regain hit points as a bonus action
fighter.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.

fighter.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
fighter.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.

fighter.name: Fighting Style: Defense
fighter.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

fighter.name: Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting
fighter.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property.

fighter.name: Action Surge
fighter.shortDescription: Take an additional action on your turn
fighter.description: You can push yourself beyond your normal limits for a moment. On your turn, you can take one additional action. Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

fighter.name: Martial Archetype
fighter.description: You choose an archetype that you strive to emulate in your combat styles and techniques: Champion, Battle Master, or Eldritch Knight. Your archetype grants you features at 3rd level and again at 7th, 10th, 15th, and 18th level.

fighter.name: Extra Attack
fighter.shortDescription: Attack twice when you take the Attack action
fighter.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn. The number of attacks increases to three when you reach 11th level and to four when you reach 20th level.

fighter.name: Indomitable
fighter.description: You can reroll a saving throw that you fail. If you do so, you must use the new roll, and you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

barbarian.name: Rage
barbarian.shortDescription: Enter a battle fury for bonus damage and resistance
barbarian.description: In battle, you fight with primal ferocity. On your turn, you can enter a rage as a bonus action. While raging, you gain advantage on Strength checks and saving throws, +2 damage to melee attacks, and resistance to physical damage.
effects: Advantage on STR checks and saves

barbarian.name: Unarmored Defense
barbarian.shortDescription: AC = 10 + DEX + CON when not wearing armor
barbarian.description: While you are not wearing any armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Constitution modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

barbarian.name: Reckless Attack
barbarian.shortDescription: Gain advantage but give advantage to attackers
barbarian.description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

barbarian.name: Danger Sense
barbarian.shortDescription: Advantage on DEX saves you can see
barbarian.description: You gain an uncanny sense of when things nearby aren't as they should be, giving you an edge when you dodge away from danger. You have advantage on Dexterity saving throws against effects that you can see, such as traps and spells. To gain this benefit, you can't be blinded, deafened, or incapacitated.

barbarian.name: Primal Path
barbarian.description: You choose a path that shapes the nature of your rage: Path of the Berserker or Path of the Totem Warrior. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

barbarian.name: Extra Attack
barbarian.shortDescription: Attack twice when you take the Attack action
barbarian.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

barbarian.name: Fast Movement
barbarian.description: Your speed increases by 10 feet while you aren't wearing heavy armor.

barbarian.name: Feral Instinct
barbarian.description: Your instincts are so honed that you have advantage on initiative rolls. Additionally, if you are surprised at the beginning of combat and aren't incapacitated, you can act normally on your first turn, but only if you enter your rage before doing anything else on that turn.

barbarian.name: Brutal Critical
barbarian.shortDescription: Roll one additional weapon damage die on critical
barbarian.description: You can roll one additional weapon damage die when determining the extra damage for a critical hit with a melee attack.

barbarian.name: Relentless Rage
barbarian.shortDescription: Stay conscious with 1 HP when raging
barbarian.description: Your rage can keep you fighting despite grievous wounds. If you drop to 0 hit points while you're raging and don't die outright, you can make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Each time you use this feature after the first, the DC increases by 5.

rogue.name: Sneak Attack
rogue.shortDescription: Deal extra damage when you have advantage
rogue.description: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.

rogue.name: Thieves' Cant
rogue.shortDescription: Secret language and code for rogues
rogue.description: During your rogue training you learned thieves' cant, a secret mix of dialect, jargon, and code that allows you to hide messages in seemingly normal conversation. It takes four times longer to convey such a message than it does to speak the same idea plainly.

rogue.name: Cunning Action
rogue.shortDescription: Dash, Disengage, or Hide as a bonus action
rogue.description: Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take a bonus action on each of your turns in combat. This action can be used only to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

rogue.name: Roguish Archetype
rogue.description: You choose an archetype that you emulate in the exercise of your rogue abilities: Thief, Assassin, or Arcane Trickster. Your archetype choice grants you features at 3rd level and then again at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

rogue.name: Uncanny Dodge
rogue.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

rogue.name: Evasion
rogue.shortDescription: Take no damage on successful DEX saves
rogue.description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

rogue.name: Reliable Talent
rogue.description: You have refined your chosen skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

rogue.name: Blindsense
rogue.description: If you are able to hear, you are aware of the location of any hidden or invisible creature within 10 feet of you.

rogue.name: Slippery Mind
rogue.description: You have acquired greater mental strength. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

rogue.name: Elusive
rogue.shortDescription: No attack has advantage against you
rogue.description: You are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.

rogue.name: Stroke of Luck
rogue.shortDescription: Turn a miss into a hit once per short rest
rogue.description: You have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need to. If your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20.

wizard.name: Arcane Recovery
wizard.shortDescription: Recover spell slots during short rest
wizard.description: You have learned to regain some of your magical energy by studying your spellbook. Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half your wizard level (rounded up).

cleric.name: Channel Divinity: Turn Undead
cleric.description: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

paladin.name: Lay on Hands
paladin.shortDescription: Heal yourself or others with divine power
paladin.description: Your blessed touch can heal wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool, you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your paladin level Ã— 5.

paladin.name: Divine Smite
paladin.shortDescription: Expend spell slot to deal extra radiant damage
paladin.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one spell slot to deal radiant damage to the target, in addition to the weapon's damage. The extra damage is 2d8 for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 1d8 for each spell level higher than 1st.

ranger.name: Favored Enemy
ranger.shortDescription: Advantage on tracking and knowledge of specific creature types
ranger.description: You have significant experience studying, tracking, hunting, and even talking to a certain type of enemy. Choose a type of favored enemy. You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on Intelligence checks to recall information about them.

ranger.name: Natural Explorer
ranger.shortDescription: Ignore difficult terrain, advantage on initiative
ranger.description: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment. When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled. While traveling for an hour or more in your favored terrain, difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel, you can't become lost except by magical means, you remain alert to danger even when engaged in another activity, and you can move stealthily at a normal pace while alone.

ranger.name: Fighting Style: Archery
ranger.shortDescription: +2 bonus to attack rolls with ranged weapons
ranger.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

ranger.name: Spellcasting
ranger.description: You have learned to use the magical essence of nature to cast spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for ranger spells.

ranger.name: Primeval Awareness
ranger.shortDescription: Sense presence of certain creature types
ranger.description: You can use your action and expend one ranger spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend, you can sense whether the following types of creatures are present within 1 mile of you: aberrations, celestials, dragons, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

ranger.name: Extra Attack
ranger.shortDescription: Attack twice when you take the Attack action
ranger.description: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

ranger.name: Land's Stride
ranger.shortDescription: Move through nonmagical difficult terrain without penalty
ranger.description: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

ranger.name: Hide in Plain Sight
ranger.shortDescription: +10 bonus to Stealth when not moving
ranger.description: You can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. You must have access to fresh mud, dirt, plants, soot, and other naturally occurring materials with which to create your camouflage. Once you are camouflaged in this way, you can try to hide by pressing yourself up against a solid surface that is at least as tall and wide as you are. You gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking actions.

ranger.name: Vanish
ranger.shortDescription: Can't be tracked except by magical means, Hide as bonus action
ranger.description: You can use the Hide action as a bonus action on your turn. Also, you can't be tracked by nonmagical means, unless you choose to leave a trail.

ranger.name: Feral Senses
ranger.description: You gain preternatural senses that help you fight creatures you can't see. When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it. You are also aware of the location of any invisible creature within 30 feet of you, provided that the creature isn't hidden from you and you aren't blinded or deafened.

ranger.name: Foe Slayer
ranger.shortDescription: Add Wisdom modifier to attack or damage vs favored enemy
ranger.description: You become an unparalleled hunter of your enemies. Once on each of your turns, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack roll or the damage roll of an attack you make against one of your favored enemies. You can choose to use this feature before or after the roll, but before any effects of the roll are applied.

monk.name: Martial Arts
monk.shortDescription: Use DEX for unarmed strikes, deal 1d4 damage
monk.description: Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for attacks with monk weapons or unarmed strikes. You can roll a d4 in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon.

monk.name: Ki
monk.shortDescription: Spend ki points for special abilities
monk.description: Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. You have 2 ki points. You can spend these points to fuel various ki features. When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest.

monk.name: Flurry of Blows
monk.shortDescription: Make two unarmed strikes as bonus action (1 ki)
monk.description: Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to make two unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

warlock.name: Eldritch Blast
warlock.shortDescription: Fire a beam of crackling energy (cantrip)
warlock.description: A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

warlock.name: Otherworldly Patron
warlock.description: You have struck a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice: the Archfey, the Fiend, or the Great Old One. Your choice grants you features at 1st level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

warlock.name: Eldritch Invocations
warlock.description: In your study of occult lore, you have unearthed eldritch invocations, fragments of forbidden knowledge that imbue you with an abiding magical ability.

warlock.name: Pact Boon
warlock.shortDescription: Receive a gift from your patron
warlock.description: Your otherworldly patron bestows a gift upon you for your loyal service. You gain one of the following features of your choice: Pact of the Chain, Pact of the Blade, or Pact of the Tome.

warlock.name: Mystic Arcanum (6th level)
warlock.description: Your patron bestows upon you a magical secret called an arcanum. Choose one 6th-level spell from the warlock spell list as this arcanum. You can cast your arcanum spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

bard.name: Bardic Inspiration
bard.shortDescription: Inspire allies with a d6 bonus
bard.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. As a bonus action, choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die (d6). Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes.

bard.name: Jack of All Trades
bard.shortDescription: Add half proficiency to any ability check
bard.description: You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

bard.name: Song of Rest
bard.description: You can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points by spending Hit Dice at the end of the short rest, each of those creatures regains an extra 1d6 hit points.

bard.name: Expertise
bard.shortDescription: Double proficiency bonus for two skills
bard.description: Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.

bard.name: Font of Inspiration
bard.shortDescription: Regain Bardic Inspiration on short rest
bard.description: You regain all of your expended uses of Bardic Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

bard.name: Countercharm
bard.shortDescription: Grant advantage against being frightened or charmed
bard.description: You can use musical notes or words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As an action, you can start a performance that lasts until the end of your next turn. During that time, you and any friendly creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

bard.name: Magical Secrets
bard.description: You have plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines. Choose two spells from any classes, including this one. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast, as shown on the Bard table, or a cantrip. The chosen spells count as bard spells for you.

druid.name: Druidic
druid.shortDescription: Know the secret language of druids
druid.description: You know Druidic, the secret language of druids. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden messages. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message's presence with a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Perception) check but can't decipher it without magic.

druid.name: Wild Shape
druid.description: You can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have seen before. You can use this feature twice. You regain expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. You can stay in a beast shape for a number of hours equal to half your druid level (rounded down).

druid.name: Druid Circle
druid.description: You choose to identify with a circle of druids: the Circle of the Land or the Circle of the Moon. Your choice grants you features at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

druid.name: Wild Shape Improvement
druid.shortDescription: Can transform into beasts with swimming speed
druid.description: You can use your Wild Shape to transform into a beast with a swimming speed.

druid.name: Wild Shape (Flying)
druid.shortDescription: Can transform into beasts with flying speed
druid.description: You can use your Wild Shape to transform into a beast with a flying speed.

druid.name: Timeless Body
druid.shortDescription: Age slower and no longer need food or water
druid.description: The primal magic that you wield causes you to age more slowly. For every 10 years that pass, your body ages only 1 year.

druid.name: Archdruid
druid.description: You can use your Wild Shape an unlimited number of times. Additionally, you can ignore the verbal and somatic components of your druid spells, as well as any material components that lack a cost and aren't consumed by a spell.

sorcerer.name: Sorcerous Origin
sorcerer.shortDescription: Choose the source of your magic
sorcerer.description: Choose a sorcerous origin, which describes the source of your innate magical power: Draconic Bloodline or Wild Magic. Your choice grants you features when you select it at 1st level and again at 6th, 14th, and 18th level.

sorcerer.name: Font of Magic
sorcerer.shortDescription: Tap into deep wellspring of magic
sorcerer.description: You can tap into the wellspring of magic within yourself. You have 2 sorcery points. You can use your sorcery points to gain additional spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain additional sorcery points.

sorcerer.name: Metamagic
sorcerer.shortDescription: Twist spells to suit your needs
sorcerer.description: You gain the ability to twist your spells to suit your needs. You gain two Metamagic options of your choice. You gain another one at 10th and 17th level. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless otherwise noted.

sorcerer.name: Metamagic: Careful Spell
sorcerer.description: When you cast a spell that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, you can protect some of those creatures from the spell's full force. To do so, you spend 1 sorcery point and choose a number of those creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). A chosen creature automatically succeeds on its saving throw against the spell.

sorcerer.name: Metamagic: Empowered Spell
sorcerer.description: When you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). You must use the new rolls. You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

sorcerer.name: Metamagic: Quickened Spell
sorcerer.description: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

sorcerer.name: Metamagic: Twinned Spell
sorcerer.shortDescription: Target two creatures with one spell
sorcerer.description: When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip).

sorcerer.name: Sorcerous Restoration
sorcerer.shortDescription: Regain sorcery points on short rest
sorcerer.description: You regain 4 expended sorcery points whenever you finish a short rest.
